title: Maintenance & Sanitation Files
description: Documentation requirements for maintenance and sanitation programs including preventive maintenance schedules, equipment calibration records, cleaning schedules, and sanitation verification records

requirements.question: Does the facility have a preventative maintenance program that includes a schedule and completion records?
Are there logs of maintenance work and repairs and are they signed off when work is completed?
Are there logs showing that equipment is properly cleaned and sanitized after maintenance and repair work has been completed?
Is there a written cleaning schedule (Master Sanitation Schedule) that shows what and where is to be cleaned and how often?
Are there written cleaning and sanitation procedures (Sanitation Standard Operating Procedures) for the facility and all equipment?
Are cleaning and sanitation logs on file that show what was done, when and by who?
Are there records showing verification of cleaning and sanitizing chemical concentrations?

Are there documented procedures and completion records for clean-in-place (CIP) activities (e.g., cleaning re-circulating water systems such as washing flumes, ice injectors, hydrocoolers, chilled water systems, ice makers, etc.), where applicable?
Are there sanitation logs on file indicating that floor drains are cleaned on a regular basis (minimum daily in wet and fresh-cut production areas)?
Are there records showing filters in air conditioning, evaporative coolers, ventilation and air filtration units are regularly cleaned and replaced?
Are there records showing cooling units are maintenance serviced and cleaned at least every 12 months or more frequently as required?
Is there a routine program and written procedure to verify cleaning effectiveness using rapid surface monitoring checks (e.g., ATP, allergen specific proteins, general proteins)?
Is there a documented glass and brittle plastic management procedure (including company glass and brittle plastic policy, glass breakage procedure and where necessary a glass register)?

capaInject: Implement corrective actions when preventive maintenance schedules are not followed including immediate equipment inspection and catch-up scheduling
Establish procedures for verifying proper cleaning and sanitization of equipment after maintenance work before returning to food production
Develop action plans when Master Sanitation Schedule compliance audits reveal missed cleaning tasks or inadequate frequency
Create verification procedures to ensure Sanitation Standard Operating Procedures are followed correctly and updated when processes change
Implement preventive measures when sanitation verification testing reveals persistent contamination requiring enhanced cleaning protocols
traceabilityInject: Maintain preventive maintenance program documentation including schedules, completion records, and sign-offs for all food processing equipment
Keep maintenance work logs documenting repairs, parts replaced, and approval signatures when work is completed
Retain records of equipment cleaning and sanitization verification performed after maintenance activities before production resumption
Archive Master Sanitation Schedules showing what areas and equipment are cleaned, cleaning frequencies, and responsible personnel
Document Sanitation Standard Operating Procedures with cleaning chemicals used, concentrations, contact times, and verification methods
micro_inject: Inadequate equipment cleaning allows biofilm formation providing protected environments for Listeria monocytogenes persistence
Maintenance activities that disturb equipment surfaces can release biofilm fragments containing high concentrations of pathogenic bacteria
Failure to properly sanitize equipment after repairs introduces environmental contaminants including Salmonella and E. coli into food contact zones
Poor sanitation of hard-to-clean areas creates harborage sites for Listeria monocytogenes that continuously recontaminate processed products
Insufficient contact time or concentration of sanitizers fails to eliminate vegetative cells and allows rapid recolonization of cleaned surfaces
